6.30.18  11:26 am   6.30.18 1:12am I wrote a song that could either be considered to be in 3/4, with a tempo of 162, or in 4/4, with a tempo of 54 (so each "3/4" measure would equal one beat if it was in 4/4). Is there a right or wrong way to interpret this?

     One time you talked about a "reasonability zone" of tempos between 60 and 120 bpm and neither of these tempos is in that zone so I think this is sort of An exception to that rule. Thoughts?

6.29.18  2:51 am   yo bill wurtz, i obv like ur songs cuz i think, well at least, that u share the same opinion as me (that i think every1 should have) bout everythin' being that love is the center of everythin'. sounds simple, is obvious. anywy my question is, i like your songs and music videos so much i listen to them in full screen sometimes on my 4k tv (or my dad's 4k tv, whatever's more accurate 4 u.) is there any way i can download them in blu-ray type bitrate levels? youtubes bitrate obv sux duh. my fav song (cuz i get them i think) being la dee da that 1 btw i love how when i first listened to it the tempo seemed so much fkin faster than when i listen to it now (literally, it sounds so slow & relaxing now.) anyway thats all. i wanna download ur music vids in like super high bitrate cuz youtube is fine for most peeps but i notice it XD aight ty bill ur awesome
